during the dinosaur era there is no arctic ice caps , and antarctica is sub-tropical .

many palentological discoveries are not made by professionals .

in patagona , you have the largest herbivore and the largest predator , livng at roughly the same perid and in the same territory .
there is no easy answer .
evolution followed a nmber of particular paths .
but a simpler interpretatin rest on a warm climate and the fertile land , with all the vegetation you can eat .
yet another thory tells us that large herbivores had to grow big enugh , to accommodate a large stmch required to digest high in fibre , low in protein vegetation .
